revised_title: A Novel Method for Measuring the Viscosity of Vapors of Volatile Liquids: Application to Bromine
tldr: The authors develop a method to measure the viscosity of volatile liquid vapors, specifically bromine, using a capillary tube and transpiration formula. The method involves estimating pressures at the two ends of the capillary tube and measuring the quantity of gas passing through it. The results can be applied to other volatile substances like iodine, phosphorus, and sulfur.
